creator: Alexander Terp
title: RAD-19: Dynamic json field definitions (e.g. off string interpolation)
description:
```
args:
  name string

// alternatives
a = json.{name}
b = json."{name}"
c = json["{name}"]
d = json_path([name])
```

Thoughts:

* A: Seems inconsistent, though arguably consistent with map.dot.syntax. Don't love it.
* B: Seems a bit better/consistent than A, and might be consistent depending on how we implement RAD-48.
* C: Maybe. Feels like the vegetable option. But also maybe surprising, don't love it either.
* D: This might be pretty decent/flexible actually. The big advantage here is that it's _truly_ dynamic.
